perturbation.original_text: 1.03.  Terms. Terms are net cash upon delivery.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.03.  Terms. Terms are net 30 days from the date of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction because Section 1.03 initially states that payment terms are 'net cash upon delivery,' meaning immediate payment is required. However, the modification changes this to 'net 30 days from the date of invoice,' providing a 30-day payment window. This introduces uncertainty in enforcement, as it's unclear whether payment is due immediately or within 30 days.

perturbation.original_text: 5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of thirty (30) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for any sales to end-user consumers, the warranty period shall be 180 days. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.explanation: The original warranty period is 90 days, but the modified text introduces a conflicting warranty period of 180 days for sales to end-user consumers. This in-text contradiction creates uncertainty about which warranty period applies in specific scenarios, potentially leading to disputes over warranty claims.

perturbation.original_text: 6.01.  Term. The term of this Agreement shall terminate on May 31, 2015, unless sooner terminated. Termination shall not relieve either party of obligations incurred prior thereto.  The term of this Agreement may be extended for an additional two year period with the written consent of both parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.01.  Term. The term of this Agreement shall terminate on May 31, 2015, unless sooner terminated. Termination shall not relieve either party of obligations incurred prior thereto. The term of this Agreement shall automatically be extended for an additional two year period, unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal at least 90 days prior to the termination date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires written consent from both parties to extend the agreement, while the modified text states the agreement automatically extends unless either party provides a written notice of non-renewal. This is a contradiction because one clause requires mutual agreement for extension, while the other implies automatic extension unless actively prevented. This creates uncertainty about the process and requirements for extending the agreement.
